item.title: Watch J Mascis Cover Tom Petty And Jam With Kevin Shields At Dinosaur Jr’s Rock Camp
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: This week, Dinosaur Jr are hosting a three-day music event called Camp Fuzz at the Full Moon Resort in upstate New York. The guest list includes My Bloody Valentine's Kevin Shields, Fred Armisen, Fucked Up's Damian Abraham, and what seems like it'll be a whole lot of interaction with the Dino Jr crew. …

item.title: Seeking Clarity About Clairo
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: A new kind of pop star: In a musical landscape full of false messiahs billing themselves as game-changers, it's easy to scoff at the notion, but truly transformative figures come along more often than you'd think. How many musical inflection points have been sparked by a magnetic persona who synthesizes a bunch of trends and…

item.title: A$AP Rocky Testifies In Sweden, Says He Acted In Self-Defense
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: American rapper A$AP Rocky testified Thursday at his assault trial in Sweden that he did everything possible to avoid a confrontation with two men he said were persistently following his entourage in Stockholm, but one of those men picked a fight with one of his bodyguards.
item.content:encoded: American rapper A$AP Rocky testified Thursday at his assault trial in Sweden that he did everything possible to avoid a confrontation with two men he said were persistently following his entourage in Stockholm, but one of those men picked a fight with one of his bodyguards. More »

item.title: Juliana Hatfield – “De Do Do Do, De Da Da Da” (The Police Cover)
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: Juliana Hatfield has been busy. Last year, the '90s alt-rock veteran and former Blake Babies frontwoman released Juliana Hatfield Sings Olivia Newton-John, a full-length album of Olivia Newton-John covers. Early this year, she followed that up with Weird, a full-length album of original songs. And now she's getting back into the covers game with another…

Last year, the '90s alt-rock veteran and former Blake Babies frontwoman released Juliana Hatfield Sings Olivia Newton-John, a full-length album of Olivia Newton-John covers. item.title: Counterfeit Madison – “Coma”
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: Counterfeit Madison comprises queer Nigerian-American rock pianist and soul singer Sharon Udoh along with bassist Adam Hardy and drummer Seth Daily. The Columbus trio has been steadily releasing music since their formation in 2014. They're currently working on their third full length, Knucklehead, which is a follow up to their 2017 release, Opposable Thumbs. We premiered the video…

item.title: Hear Denzel Curry’s Spotify Session With Fucked Up & Bad Brains
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: When artists roll through the Spotify Studios, they typically record a cover of a song for the streaming service's Spotify Singles series. But not many artists recruit the actual musicians who made the original songs to play with them, which is exactly what Denzel Curry did for his entry.
item.content:encoded: When artists roll through the Spotify Studios, they typically record a cover of a song for the streaming service's Spotify Singles series. item.title: Slaughter Beach, Dog Or: How Jake Ewald Learned To Stop Worrying And Love Wilco
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: Over the past year, Jake Ewald's tastes have evolved, man. The Slaughter Beach, Dog mastermind has found himself drawn towards music with nuance and a little more space to breathe -- things the 26-year-old can respect "now that my attention span's gotten slightly longer." His newfound appreciation for the slow build shows in the way…

item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: Mikal Cronin returned recently with "Undertow" and "Breathe," his first new songs in four years. And there's more where that came from: Today, the California garage-rocker and Ty Segall super-friend has announced Seeker, his fourth full-length album, his first since 2015's MCIII, and the first to break his numbered self-titled naming convention.

item.title: Guaxe – “Desafio Do Guaxe”
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description: Guaxe is a new duo of Brazilian psych-rockers Dino Almeida of Boogarins and Pedro Bonifrate of Supercordas. Pronounced "gwah-shee," the name comes from an Atlantic forest bird who builds tent-shaped nests that hang on tall trees. These birds are also pretty adept singers.

item.title: A$AP Rocky Pleads Not Guilty, US Presidential Envoy Sent To Sweden For His Trial
item.dc:creator: Stereogum
item.description:
A$AP Rocky pleaded not guilty to assault as his trial in Sweden opened Tuesday (July 30), a month after a street fight that landed him in jail and became a topic of U.S.-Swedish diplomacy.
Rocky, whose real name is Rakim Mayers, is accused with two others of beating a 19-year-old man in Stockholm…
